On 28Jan2021 the patient experienced It is painful there today, but she has not taken pain medicine. It is painful in the top of her right shoulder. Her Left shoulder is very bad, but she is refusing to get it done because it is a whole year of recuperation all over again. Her left shoulder gets painful so the doctor gives her cortisone shots. Three weeks prior, she had an injection of cortisone down the left shoulder blade and into the top of the shoulder. When she got home, after the COVID vaccine, she just had that funny feeling in her throat. Her body was fine. She thought she was fine. She called her brother and kids and told them she had no reaction. Then in between 20-21 that same day, all at once, she experienced excruciating pain in her left shoulder, and down her shoulder blade where she had received the Cortisone shots. Her right arm, where she got the shot was hurting as well. The muscle on the whole arm hurt. She was afraid she was going to loose her right arm too. The left arm would just hang. She could not move it. All she could do was lay down and not move. It was terrible. Sunday afternoon, she had Norco on hand, and took some of that. That helped it a little bit. Sunday night and noon time she took a Norco as well. The next day, she just took one at night, but there was still pain there. She didn't call because she kept think tomorrow it will get better. Now, finally it has subsided some. Yesterday, 28Jan2021, she had to take a pain pill because she could feel it coming back. Before that, she hadn't taken any Norco in 24 hours. It is painful there today, but she has not taken pain medicine. It is painful in the top of her right shoulder. It is like it is attacking the weakest links in her body. She can feel it in her hip too. She still cannot lay on her left side. Her right arm is still sore in the upper arm, between the elbow and shoulder. Before it was her wholearm though. She felt the funny feeling all through her body, it went up to her head. She has a therapist that works on her too. The pain was on her left side, and went right on down her body. She felt a warmness in her body after the shot within an hour, but it went away. She felt better after she left the place she got the vaccine. She had to wait her 15 minutes. She went and got something to eat, and 10 minutes later, she was feeling better. The vaccine seemed to affect everything she has been treated for. She also has a nurse that checks on her every week too, and the nurse is coming over today. Her shoulder is bone on bone. Her left shoulder gets painful so the doctor gives her cortisone shots. Caller stated she had had some respiratory issues and allergies and so on. Caller stated she was here for 56 years and her mother died of old age so she was not sure. There were no concomitant medications. The patient previously took advil. Caller stated she used to take Advil when she went to the gym and had problems but she hasn't taken Advil for a while. She didn't take meds. Caller stated she didn't drink or smoke because what it did was it gave you a release. Caller stated she was not taking none, she was pushing through and hoping it will heal itself. The patient experienced blood clot in right leg on 26Mar2021, break in rash on an unspecified date, headache on 09Mar2021, slight fever on 09Mar2021, veins are swollen on 12Mar2021, right knee got swollen on 12Mar2021, sore throat on an unspecified date, ear ache on 10Mar2021, nausea on 09Mar2021, rash in mouth and throat on an unspecified date, felt like burning/ sore in her mouth like she was burned on 10Mar2021, sore in her mouth like she was burned on 10Mar2021, dizzy on an unspecified date, weak on an unspecified date, felt like sleeping all the time on an unspecified date, couldn't walk on 12Mar2021, pain in her arm on an unspecified date. Was a first responder, sometimes break in rash once in a while. Got Pfizer 1st vaccine 09Mar, was scared to have difficulty breathing however had headache, slight fever, right knee and veins were swollen, sore throat, ear ache, nausea, rash in mouth and throat also felt like burning also was dizzy and weak and felt like sleeping all the time. Caller stated she was told by her doctor to take the shot on 09Mar2021. Caller stated she had headache, slight fever, then her head was ok the fever was gone but the headache persisted as of today. Caller stated she still had headache and ear ache and her knee got swollen, her right knee. Caller stated for a few days she couldn't walk. Caller reported she has arthritic conditions in knees, she exercises everyday and no problem, but she couldn't walk for a few days. Caller states now she is able to walk on something, but the veins in the knee were still there and she didn't know. Caller stated she was due for second next on Tuesday and she was wondering what to do. Caller stated she was honestly worried about this reaction after the first shot. Caller stated she was told the 2nd had a worse reaction, so she was really weary and worried. Caller stated she only slept 5 hours at night, but now she wanted to sleep all the time. Caller stated she had such a headache and earache. Caller stated it made her nauseous, like in a sea or something. She stated she didn't know how to explain. She didn't vomit like when you were nauseous, it wasn't that feeling. Caller stated it was just lingering like when you were in the ocean. Caller reported headache has gotten better. It has gotten worse and then gotten better. Caller stated the earache was so painful and was still there. Caller reported she got it during the day and when she lied down, but the severity had subsided. Caller stated she didn't measure fever. She wanted to say after that, her mouth was sore after fever from the heat or from the vaccination. Caller stated her mouth was still today, still sensitive. Caller reported it was like her throat and her mouth was so sore like a burn. Caller reported her headache was mostly on the left side, but went to the right side too. Caller reported she could feel it in her eye, it hurt and her ear hurt. Caller reported her sore throat, the upper part, was still sensitive. Caller stated she couldn't swallow, but it was clear, her mouth was clear, only the upper top she would say. Caller stated it's 99% gone, its healing. Nauseous, like in a sea, its not like she has it all day long- nauseous- maybe once a day, nothing severely like what she had for a few things. The patient had a pain in her arm and she had that symptom one night and the following day she had nothing. Her arm was cooperative. Since she had been diagnosed with a blood clot. She saw her doctor on Friday and was recommended that she took some medications. She continued to have headache which she reported, though not as bad. She also reported that she had a sore mouth and earache. She was still fighting symptoms and didn't know what to do with the blood clot. She was scared to take the blood thinner Eliquis and that she will have side effects that it will do her harm she felt Eliquis will do her harm if she received the second dose of the vaccine or takes Eliquis. She was supposed to 20mg daily which she felt will kill her given her body was not healed from receiving the first dose of the Covid-19 vaccine. There was no prior vaccinations within 4 weeks. She was prescribed Eliquis Film-coated tablet (Lot Number: ABN4449S, Expiry date: Feb2023) 20mg daily for blood clot but had not started because she felt it will kill her was scared to take the second dose of the vaccine. The patient underwent lab tests and procedures which included Sonogram: blood clot in right on 26Mar2021. Therapeutic measures were taken as a result of blood clot in right leg. There was Physician Office Visit for all events. The patient was not pregnant. No known allergies. On 30Jan2021, the patient fell and became unconscious after getting up from bed to use bathroom, was able to get up and go back to bed. Next day, 31Jan2021, she told her daughter at 2pm what had happened and daughter took her to urgent care. Urgent care was performed EKG and called ambulance as EKG suggested suspicious activity. She was coughing with blood. Cat scan of the lung revealed acute saddle pulmonary embolism with acute cor pulmonale and a large blood clot in the calf. On 02Feb201 then placed her on blood thinner and discharged her. As soon as arrived home, she began to suffer a massive gastro intestinal bleed and was rushed back to the hospital. On 04Feb2021, she began to have heart issues and suffered a mild heart attack and underwent a procedure to have a stent inserted. She developed the shingles the next day (05Feb2021). The events assessed as serious due to Hospitalization, Life threatening illness (immediate risk of death from the event), Disability or permanent damage. The patient visited Emergency room/department or urgent care. The outcome of events was resolved with sequel. Treatment therapy involved. The patient was not diagnosed with COVID prior vaccination. After the first vaccine she experienced pain in arm and pain between the eyes. She also had flu like symptoms for approximately 3 days, and unusual bowel movements not diarrhea, not constipated, but not normal and painful. After second dose had similar reaction bowel issues are still bad and very painful (to the point of vomiting during bowel movements due to pain). She saw her primary care doctor and was Rx'd a cream. This has caused her to decrease her eating. This did not help and she was having loss of visual acuity and started not being able to speak properly so went to the ED for concern over Strokes. had 2 MRIs, and determined not to be having a stroke so was released to home. Sxs seemed to resolve ( like a spell) . Was still having bowel issues and she also developed a rash from the neck to the groin. So she went to a specialist. The Rash cleared after about 3 days. Specialist advised that the sxs were all due to the COVID Vaccine. Flank pain under the right ribs has also been present, this is not improving, it is a dull pain that seems to be worsening ( the bowel seems to be about back to normal now) She is planning on speaking with her PCP about the right flank pain.

shingles; burning bumps; rash/breaking out spot; back ache; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient) and additional consumer (patient's daughter). An 81-year-old female patient received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, solution for injection), dose 1 intramuscular, administered in right arm on 26Feb2021 13:45 (lot number: EN6198) at the age of 81 years old, as single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. Medical history included osteoporosis and macular degeneration in both eyes. The patient's concomitant medications were not reported. Historical vaccination included shingles vaccine (SHINGRIX) on an unspecified date (about 5 years ago) for immunization. The patient did not receive any other vaccine four weeks prior to COVID vaccine. Patient mentioned she received her first COVID-19 vaccine on 26Feb2021. Then on 02Mar2021, she started having a back ache. Then by Friday, 05Mar2021 she started breaking out on her right side. She thought at first it was due to her using a heating pad for her back which was sore. Then on Sunday morning on 07Mar2021 she noticed a new breaking out area on her stomach. She thought she might have shingles. She was seen at her primary care doctor on 08Mar2021 and was told it was shingles. She was prescribed an antiviral drug now. She wanted to know if she should get the second COVID-19 shot and if the antiviral drug affect her getting the second shot. Patient noticed the breaking out on her right side towards her stomach and it may have started a day earlier. If it started on her back, she wasn't aware and she didn't feel it until Friday 05Mar2021. The breaking out started on her right side around towards her torso and a little backwards towards her back. On her waistline, lower than her waistline, a little bit lower. Right where her thigh meets her torso. Like her hip kind of like a crack there. The backache she can't feel any more, she wondered if the backache was a precursor to shingles or not. Referring to the backache, maybe she didn't notice it, maybe it was on 08Mar2021 that she didn't notice the backache anymore. Patient's daughter mentioned her mom was still on 07Mar2021. On Friday 05Mar2021 at bedtime she noticed the breaking out area, and it still burns, the bumps. The rash/breaking out spot is still there and hurts. They are bumps not blisters. When she looked at it this morning 09Mar2021 after taking three of the anti-viral pills the breaking out area is not as bright, maybe a little duller red color. She uses a magnifying glass when probed for details from the Patient Vaccination Card. She has low vision in both eyes due to macular degeneration. She went to the doctor on 08Mar2021. She was prescribed antiviral, Valacyclovir 1 gram tablet, take 1 tablet by mouth 3 times daily. She started taking this on 08Mar2021, was prescribed 21 pills for 7 days. NDC/Lot#/Expiry unknown, discard after Mar2022. Did not see on bottle to provide. When asked about if print was small it was clarified this was a blue bottle filled by the pharmacy. It is not a manufacturer bottle. She first saw the breaking out area on Friday 05Mar2021 night and didn't think anything about it until Sunday 07Mar2021 when she had a new break out. Her second COVID-19 injection is scheduled for 19Mar2021. She did have shingles shot about 5 years ago. And she knows they have a new one, but she has not taken the new one. Her doctor told her yesterday 08Mar2021 to get the shingles vaccine. She hasn't decided if she's getting the shingles vaccine or not. The event shingles required visit to Physician office. The patient recovered from backache on 08Mar2021; recovering from shingles; while outcome of the remaining events was unknown.

She added that she now has a rash on her arm. Yesterday, she had 2 spots and today it went down to her arm and elbow. Her doctor prescribed her antivirals. Close
A whole-body rash was evident 2-3 weeks after the first vaccine dose. Subject was unsure at the time if it was vaccine related. Severe swelling of hands and legs began the same day after the second vaccine dose with general malaise and concerns about fainting. Oral steroids were prescribed for 2 weeks, and progression of the symptoms seem to stabilize during steroid treatment. After steroid treatment, the symptoms resumed at full strength with swelling in the hands and legs causing the superficial skin to peel off and split down into the dermis with bleeding and pain. Joints in the hands and legs were painful. Severe swelling and pain in the hands and legs persisted for at least 6 weeks after the second vaccine dose. A diuretic was prescribed at about 4-5 weeks after the second vaccine dose. The subject is currently reporting improved symptoms.

Patient explained that she had trouble with the flu shot prior, having weakness and low blood pressure and that's why she got so nervous to get it, she was exhausted from that. There were no concomitant medications. After the onset of events, her husband suggested to take benadryl, and so she took 1 yesterday. Patient received the first dose of the Pfizer COVID vaccine 01Feb2021. Medical Conditions was she actually had a physical a week ago, her heart is fine, the doctor said her blood work was normal. She was just feeling unwell like she got the flu. Caller stated that it was just the normal flu shot, she hasn't had it for 5-6 years now. She has no lot number to provide. Her doctor said if it causes trouble then don't get it, a couple times she was in urgent care because of the low blood pressure, like she was going to pass out. The chills she just had once or twice yesterday. She didn't take a temperature. She clarifies that it was just 1 lymph node that was sore and raised, she can barely feel it today, it went down. Today she still felt the weakness and tiredness. Caller would like to know if it was ok for her to take Tylenol for her post vaccination symptoms. The patient underwent lab tests and procedures which included blood pressure abnormal was low and blood test was normal. Investigation assessment included All tests were normal. Patient does have anxiety; however, caller thinks that it was this covid situation and the depressing news every day. 81 2021-06-30 vaccination site pain, vaccination site redness This is a spontaneous report received from a contactable nurse (patient). A 81-year-old female patie... Read more
Close
This is a spontaneous report received from a contactable nurse (patient). A 81-year-old female patient received first dose of bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, Solution for injection, Batch/Lot number: EN6201; expiration date: 30Jun2021) via an unspecified route of administration, administered in deltoid left on 02Mar2021 11:00 as single dose for COVID-19 immunization. Medical history included Neuropathy, Diabetes, AFib, Anemia, bleeding ulcer, Rectal bleeding, Hypertension, knee bleed, osteoarthritis in hands, Bursitis, Cataracts, arthritis in knees, Stroke, hearing impairment, Diverticulitis, Internal hemorrhoids, Bunionectomy, Fall, broke her ankle, device implant, Transfusion, retinal surgery, Cataract surgery, had a positive COVID test, Cholesterol, Weak and cracked fingernails and keep blood thin, to prevent clots. Concomitant medications included Onglyza for diabetes mellitus, Pantoprazole for ulcer. Fish oil for blood cholesterol abnormal, Atorvastatin for blood cholesterol abnormal, Zocor, Colecalciferol (VITAMIN D 3), Biotin, Cyanocobalamin (Vitamin B12) for hypoaesthesia, ubidecarenone (COQ-10), macrogol 3350 (Miralax), acetylsalicylic acid (Baby Aspirin) for anticoagulant therapy, fexofenadine hydrochloride (Allegra). On an unspecified date, the patient experienced had sore arm and on 02Mar2021 had strong headache, stiffness/neck stiffness, chills, weakness, soreness all over the body, moderate soreness at the injection site after covid 19, joint pain, felt cold, tiny red spot at injection site about the size of a dime, back pain. The events were considered as non-serious by the reporter. Reporter stated that she was a Retired RN, and she had her first dose of the Pfizer Covid vaccine on 02Mar2021 at 11am, and she was scheduled for her second covid immunization on 23Mar2021. Caller has questions about side effects she experienced after the first dose and whether or not she should get the second immunization. Caller states she had a pretty strong reaction to the first injection. Caller states that she had the COVID disease in 22Oct2020, the caller went to the ER and had a positive COVID test because she had a fever, but she was sent home because her lungs were clear. She reported that both her son and her husband also got COVID around that time, but none of them had to be hospitalized. Stated that about an hour after her first injection, some soreness developed at the injection site. Later that afternoon she started to get a strong headache and her arm was getting sorer; in the evening, she started developing more joint pain in multiple joints, all over including, and especially, on her toes and feet; and her left arm was getting more sore, she got the chills, and she felt cold all the time, her temperature was 96.4; caller states that she also developed a tiny dime sized red spot at the injection site. Caller states that she also was thirsty, but she was a diabetic and that might have something to do with it. By the time it was time for her to go to sleep she was stiff and weak all over. She had neck stiffness, the feeling of being kind of stooped over. Caller was worried she would be unable to straighten up. The next morning, she still had weakness, stiffness and soreness, could hardly take a shower. She had to sit on side of tub and had to have her husband help her to get dressed. By about 10am the next day, everything started going away and by noon everything had pretty much cleared up completely and was gone. The pain in caller's feet and joints was gone by lunch and she did not have a fever. Caller states that at dinner that night, she was still weak though, and at the evening meal, she was so weak that she couldn't get up from the chair at the kitchen table alone. Once she was on her feet, she was okay, she could walk, but she uses a cane, especially when she was sick. About an hour or two later, she had a temperature of 99.4. But the next day, she didn't have a fever, and she could use that same chair without help. Caller states that she was fine by Friday and her blood sugar was 95, which was good. Caller states that she had a backache a few days following, but she has had backache before. Caller states that this was her history, she had the COVID, and she had a bleeding ulcer over a year ago now. Caller also saw a Cardiologist and had the watchman device implanted at the end of Sep2020, caller had this procedure to try and help get her off the Eliquis, which she had been on since having the stroke. Caller reports that she also had a Rectal bleed when she was put back on the Eliquis, and her doctors kept her on it because of the stroke. Caller states that she has silent A. Fib and that can throw little clots, so the doctors wanted her on a low dose of Eliquis but apparently that was too much for the caller too. Caller thinks the heart procedure is doing great and doing its job, but she was unable to go in for her follow up to the procedure, because she needed an esophageal echocardiogram to see if the device was sealed over by the heart muscle, and she couldn't have that until Jan2020, because she had to test negative for COVID twice. Caller states that her hemoglobin never really recovered more than 10 since her bleeding ulcer. But her hemoglobin went down to 7.4 and she was sent to the ER at the end of Jan2021, and she had two transfusions, and the next morning her hemoglobin went down to 7, the hospital staff thought that she must be bleeding. So the caller saw a GI doctor who said that the caller needed an endoscopy and colonoscopy to see where this was coming from, to make sure she was not bleeding from the ulcer. They saw the ulcer was healed but irritated, and the colonoscopy removed a couple polyps. The polyps were negative for cancer cells. After the caller had the COVID injection, she had blood in her stool. Caller went to the ER in the evening of 08Mar2021, and she stayed in the ER until the next morning. Caller states that the stool sample did show that there was some blood in her urine (captured as provided by the caller), and the ER did a CT of her abdomen, and they didn't see blood or diverticulitis. Caller does have a history of diverticulosis or internal hemorrhoids. Because things were going on last Fall, and things were rescheduled with the COVID disease, and things, the caller did not get her regular flu shot until 12Jan2021, because she needed two negative COVID tests prior to being able to get the Flu shot. She got two negative COVID tests on 24Dec2020 and 06Jan2021. Caller does not know if having had her flu shot in Jan2021, could have affected it. Caller was concerned and was wondering if she should take the second dose of the COVID vaccine or not. HCP Details: Caller hasn't spoken to her PCP since she was last in the hospital. She tried to call her HCP, but that office was getting a new computer system and they were having a high call volume for COVID stuff, so caller could not get through to them. Caller plans to email her doctor today. Everything has been overwhelming with all these things and people for doctors to juggle. Event Details: Caller reports that the soreness at her injection site, by the next morning, was up into her shoulder. Caller states that her niece, who was not a nurse, called the caller and told her to get the injection three fingers below the shoulder joint, because there were some instances of people getting injected into the shoulder joint. So, caller had soreness at the injection site, but within 24 hours, states that she was just sore all over, but it all went away by the afternoon the next day. Caller states that, she was told that she would have reactions more to the second injection than the first, so that was her concern, was she does not want to get the second injection and then it be worse than what she experienced. Caller had a lot of pain in her toes following the COVID injection, but she has diabetes that was well controlled, and she has neuropathy, and probably arthritis. But caller states that the pain in her toes was worse than normal, following receiving the COVID vaccine. Caller has had a bunionectomy, so she always has some numbness in the toe, and she fell and broke her ankle a few years later. But caller states that the very concerning thing was, following the COVID injection, the joint pain and soreness all over and weakness that she experienced. Caller had the stiffness together with some of the other things from her low hemoglobin anyway, as she has not fully recovered from the blood loss, but she was much better, and after the transfusions she had a hemoglobin of 10. And when caller went to the hospital lately, her hemoglobin was 9.4, and she was having it tested Tuesday morning again. Caller states that it was hard to say that everything she experienced was from the COVID vaccine, as she has a history of some of these things, including weakness. Caller finally got off the Eliquis when the hemoglobin went so low, she stopped the Eliquis maybe on 29Jan2021. Caller states that she was told by her Cardiologist that her symptoms at the time were from low Hemoglobin. Caller states that she was probably walking around with that low hemoglobin for a few days. Weakness: Caller states that at times she gets very fatigued, but she was not so weak right now. But caller states that weakness has been an up and down thing for her for the past few months, even before the COVID vaccine. Treatment: Caller took her normal Aspirin, but she did not take Tylenol even though she was told she could, and she did not take Allegra. She just took her normal medicines. History: When caller had her rectal bleed, she went into the ER on 08Mar2021, and she was sent home the next morning. Caller states that the ER was busy that evening and did not see the doctor until 10 or 11 that evening. But when the tests were finished up around 3am, the caller was told that she could go home or be admitted. Caller asked to go home but not until a little later in the morning, so she could call her family. Knee Bleed: Caller confirms it was aspirated and treated in the ER; she did not have to stay overnight. Caller saw orthopedic doctor a day or two later, and he did not order anything else. Caller walks with a cane now most the time because she is trying to avoid falling. Eliquis: Caller reports that the Eliquis was held for a few days after her GI bleed. She was taking 5mg twice a day from April or May2018. Caller had the GI bleed and the Eliquis was held for a few days and then she went back on it, then had rectal bleeding again. So, after that, caller's dose was reduced to 2.5mg twice day. The doctors did not want to take her off the Eliquis because of her prior stroke, so they just reduced her dose. The Eliquis had been preventing little TIAs and stuff in her hand and mouth and stuff. And that reduced dose was okay for a while. But caller states that she started getting those symptoms back, and several times a day she was getting the numbness, and she was scared she was going to have a stroke, so she said maybe because she was previously on mg twice a day, maybe she should up her dose to 7.5mg, and that worked well. So, caller took 5mg in the morning and 2.5mg in the evening. This was over a weekend, and on Monday the caller wrote her cardiologist, who said this dosing was not normally recommended, but if it was working for the caller, then that is okay. But then in July, the caller got the knee bleed. So, the doctors thought the caller's knee bleed was from the 2.5mg knee bleed but caller thinks she started to get that earlier because she had an episode that was similar before that, caller thought that episode in May or so was just arthritis. But, in Jul2020 her knee became swollen, very painful, and she could not get out of bed. Caller states that her son who was a weightlifter could not get her out of bed. She went to hospital via ambulance where her knee was aspirated. Caller reports that the Eliquis was not stopped due to the knee bleed, she was just told to go back to 2.5mg twice daily. Caller states that her heart doctor said that because she has had a stroke, she has to take the Eliquis to prevent stroke. Caller reports that she initially was not interested in the Watchman implant, but after all this, she decided to get that procedure so she could stop the Eliquis because she was a bleeder. The patient underwent lab tests and procedures which included colonoscopy: the ulcer was healed but irritated, endoscopy: the ulcer was healed but irritated, haemoglobin: 7.4 on Jan2021, haemoglobin: 7 on Jan2021. The outcome of sore arm and weakness was unknown, headache, stiffness/Neck stiffness, chills, soreness all over the body, moderate soreness at the injection site, Joint pain, felt cold, tiny red spot at injection site about the size of a dime were recovered on 03Mar2021 and back pain recovered on 09Mar2021.; Sender's Comments: Based on the information currently available, a possible contributory role of the suspect vaccine BNT162B2 in triggering the onset of pain in arm,toe,headache,stiffness,chills,weakness,pain,joint pain,feeling cold,vaccination site erythema,pain and pain in toe. But also consider relevant medical history and concomittant drugs . The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to Regulatory Authorities, Ethics Committees and Investigators, as appropriate

An 82-year-old female patient received bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, lot number: E73246, expiry date not reported), via an unspecified route of administration on 06Jan2021 14:15 in the left arm at single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. Medical history included cardiac pacemaker insertion, high blood pressure for years. Concomitant medication included apixaban (ELIQUIS). The patient previously took flu shot (FLU VACCINE II) and never had a reaction to the flu shot, macrodantin and experienced drug hypersensitivity and hives. It was reported that about 15:15, injection site felt like it was on fire and then the whole arm felt like it was on fire. The patient got concerned. Her throat felt like it was going to close. Symptoms got less severe. She was fine yesterday and was fine that day. She called her doctor and was advised to put cold compresses on the arm and take Tylenol. She was ok. She read an article that stated if a person had a reaction to not have the second shot. She did not know if her reaction is severe. The second shot is due around 27Jan2021. She wanted to know what to do. She felt fine on the day of report and was fine 2-3 hours after the onset of the hot and fiery feeling. It was scary and she didn't know what was happening. She also added that around 15:15, the injection arm felt like it was on fire. She felt flushed. Her throat felt like it would close up but never did. Everything resolved 2-3 hours after it started. Clinical outcome of the events was recovered on 06Jan2021.

Fever; feeling unwell; muscle pain; chills; injection site pain; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). An 82-year-old female patient (not pregnant) received the first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE) (lot number: EN5318) via an unspecified route of administration in right arm on 05Feb2021 17:15 at single dose for COVID-19 immunization. The patient medical history and concomitant medications were not reported. The patient previously took bacitracin and experienced allergies, nalidixic acid and experienced allergies. The patient experienced fever, feeling unwell, muscle pain, chills, injection site pain, all in Feb2021. No treatment received. No other vaccine in four weeks. No covid prior vaccination. No covid tested post vaccination. The outcome of the events was not recovered.

I received vaccine on Friday 02/19/2021 , Saturday woke up with rash on back and pain under left breast went to doctor 02/23/2021, they prescribed cream Triamcinolone Acetonide Cream 0.5%. then went back Monday 03/08/2021 they prescribed Valacyclovir gram every hours for 21 pills and Gabapentin for the pain for what they called shingles .

Close
itchy skin all over body, but primarily on my upper back where a red rash appeared following each of the two vaccine shots. Not sure of the date ot its first appearance following Shot #1 ; I felt fine for four days after shot # 2, then the itch and rash intensified so that I had great trouble sleeping. My upper back is itching now as I type, but seems to have begun to fade; and, the rest of my body is pretty pretty much itch free. I began applying an herbal tincture to the rash on my back on March 1st which seems to be helping calm it down.

82 2021-03-15 vaccination site mass, vaccination site bruising Headache; The needle had not been completely secured; I felt fluid rushing down my arm/solution ran ... Read more
Close
Headache; The needle had not been completely secured; I felt fluid rushing down my arm/solution ran down her arm/It ran to her elbow, she saw a collection of fluid at her elbow/ Two drops of medication leak down her arm; I had a lump on my arm the size of a large jaw breaker in my arm/hard lump at injection site/she had a hard lump the size of a large jawbreaker for about 5 hours; bruising at the site; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer reporting for herself and a nurse. A 82-years-old female patient received the first dose of bnt162b2 (BNT162B2; Lot # EL8982) vaccine, via an unspecified route of administration in the left arm on 29Jan2021 13:30 at single dose for Covid-19 immunisation . Medical history included anticoagulant therapy , bone disorder, vitamin D deficiency (vitamin supplementation), probiotic therapy, rhinorrhoea, lung congestion, dry eye . Concomitant medication included acetylsalicylic acid (ASPIRIN 81), calcium carbonate, colecalciferol (CALCIUM 500+D3), colecalciferol (D3), ascorbic acid, tocopheryl acetate, xantofyl, zeaxanthin, zinc (AREDS), bifidobacterium infantis (ALIGN) , guaifenesin (MUCINEX), macrogol 400, propylene glycol (SYSTANE), metronidazole (METRONIDAZOLE). The patient experienced the needle had not been completely secured on 29Jan2021 with outcome of unknown , felt fluid rushing down her arm/solution ran down her arm/it ran to her elbow, she saw a collection of fluid at her elbow/ two drops of medication leak down her arm on 29Jan2021 with outcome of unknown , i had a lump on my arm the size of a large jaw breaker in my arm/hard lump at injection site for about 5 hours on 29Jan2021 with outcome of recovered , bruising at the site on 29Jan2021 with outcome of not recovered , headache on 30Jan2021 with outcome of recovered. The patient took Tylenol for her headache. The patient stated that states her injection site was already black and blue when she got home and removed the bandage. Adds in her photo her whole shoulder is yellow and it looks jaundiced. The nurse stated that the incident occurred on Friday 29Jan2021 , so they had multiple different type of syringes and needles that was using to administered and they had a vaccinator who was using a lower lock syringe in which you case you know you have to secure the needle by twisting in to that lower lock and when he went to administer the vaccine to the patient two drops of medication leak down her arm, so of course we are at that point the vaccinator realize the lower lock and that the needle had not been completely secured so we don't know how much vaccine the patient actually received. Information about Lot/Batch number has been requested.

82 2021-03-20 vaccination site pain muscle pain; she did not feel good; tiredness; joint pain (thigh/hip/went down to her both legs)/all... Read more
Close
muscle pain; she did not feel good; tiredness; joint pain (thigh/hip/went down to her both legs)/all over body; pain in her back/pain right side of her back; injection site pain; chills; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (Patient herself) via medical information team. A 82-year-old female patient received first dose of BNT162B2 (Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 Vaccine, solution for injection, Lot Number: EL322/9, Expiration date: Not provided, NDC number: Not provided), via unspecified routed of administration (Anatomical location: Arm Right) on 27Jan2021 12.10 as single dose for Covid-19 immunisation. The patient medical history included on May2020 she had emergency gallbladder surgery and she had a severe low sodium level. Adds she is still taking gatorade for the sodium level (still low sodium level; doesn't even come to the bottom range) and her doctor told her not to take free water, on 9Mar2020 she had a total knee replacement, she had a hysterectomy 10 years ago She had ongoing Urinary incontinence, ongoing urinary tract infection in Jun2020 or Jul2020, patient family history includes husband passes and she is alone. The patient had no Prior Vaccinations within 4 weeks. The patient concomitant medications included vitamin d3 at 50 mcg orally once a day, oxybutynin orally 5mg twice a day, diphenhydramine hydrochloride orally 25mg once a day for allergy, cephalexin orally 250mg once a day, amitriptyline 10 mg thrice a day orally for urinary incontinence all concomitant medications are ongoing. It was reported that on 27Jan2021 2 hours later patient experienced pain in her back, injection site pain, tiredness, chills, muscle pain, and joint pain ("upper joint of both legs, 1st one leg, then 2nd leg, then both"), also stated that almost two hours to the date she felt pain 7 inches by 9 inches on the right side of her back. Eventually it went away, she also had injection site pain, tiredness; muscle pain really really bad chills; joint pain; but she had no fever; Adds she did not feel good and these effects just came one after the other. Adds she was so cold besides four sweaters and her heating blankets she was still so cold, she does get chilled a lot but this was so obvious, States she had the joint pain all over her body but especially in the joint of her thigh/hip and it went down to her legs. She is not sure when went away because she took two extra strength tylenol and it got better. Adds she lives alone because her husband passes, and she had to use a cane and it was really difficult. The outcome of the event back pain recovered on 31Jan2021, injection site pain recovered on 28Jan2021, chills recovered on 30Jan2021, Fatigue, muscle pain, Arthralgia, she did not feel good recovered on 01Feb2021.

Close
Started with arm hurting at vaccination site, Later that evening got a bad headache. Headache kept waking me during the night. Next day 8:45am temperature 99.6 degrees. At 1:00pm temperature was 100.4 degrees. On the advise of the pharmacist took 1 Tylenol at 2:00pm. Took another Tylenol at 8:00pm. My temperature at 8:15am was 98.4 degrees. The next day I felt very much better which kept improving during the day.

Close
slight redness to injection site; slight pain when they pressed down in that area; there is a little bump; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer. A 82-year-old female patient received first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE; Formulation: Solution for injection Lot Number: E18982), via an unspecified route of administration, in the right arm on 06Feb2021 08:40 AM (at the age of 82-years-old) as single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. The patient had no medical history. The patient did not receive any concomitant medications. The patient did not receive any other recent vaccinations. The patient did not underwent any lab investigation. Consumer was calling about the BNT162B2 vaccine, to say congratulations and thanks for saving the nation. He said that he was 84 years old, and he had his first vaccination this past Saturday, as did his wife who is 82. He said that they only thing he would like to report was a slight concern that the only reactions they had were slight redness at the site and slight pain when they pressed down in that area, no other side effects. He says he was concerned whether the vaccines were effective in their bodies.Caller said that their vaccine cards were handwritten and they got the same LOT. Caller said NDC/EXP were not provided on their handwritten vaccine cards. He said they got their first dose at 08:40 AM 06Feb2021, and he got his in his left arm and his wife got hers in her right arm. AE slight pain at the site treatment: Caller said that they didnot do anything to treat this, and it went away, also the slight redness went away, there was a little bump. Caller said it was not bad, it was good that their side effects were small and not massive at all, and it was a little thing but they are concerned if their reaction could be considered unusual, like some people, or if should it could be a stronger dosage. He said at the time their vaccines were done in cars, so he has no knowledge of temperature or amount of dosage, though he was sure it was right and it was good they didnot have side effects from it, he wondered about the dosage could they be less effective in their bodies? Caller declines to be transferred to another unit for his question, and said that after they get their second dose on the 17th, if they donot feel anything they would call medical information with their questions. No treatment was received for the event vaccination site pain. Outcome of the events vaccination site pain and injection site redness were recovered on an unspecified date and unknown for other event.; Sender's Comments: Linked Report(s) : US-PFIZER INC-2021195657 same reporter/drug/event, different patient
82 2021-03-30 hives After her 1st dose, she had an allergy so bad; Swelling and hives all over body; Swelling and hives ... Read more
Close
After her 1st dose, she had an allergy so bad; Swelling and hives all over body; Swelling and hives all over body; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable nurse, the patient. An 82-year-old female patient received the first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 MRNA VACCINE), via an unspecified route of administration in the arm on 23Jan2021 (at the age of 82-years-old) as a single dose for COVID-19 immunization. Medical history included the patient was on blood thinner therapy; allergy to a lot of medications, mold and cut grass; operation to remove clots in Nov2020 (two months prior to vaccination); thyroid disorder. Concomitant medications included unspecified thyroid pills and apixaban (ELIQUIS) as a blood thinner. The patient previously took moxifloxacin (AVELOX) and experienced allergy and rash and was in the hospital. On 24Jan2021 (the next day after vaccination), the patient experienced an "allergy so bad", swelling and hives all over her body. The patient went to the emergency room due to the events and was "hooked up" with intravenous (IV)s for an hour before she could go home. The reactions were assessed as related to the vaccination by the patient. The patient was scheduled for her second dose on 23Mar2021. She was not given the Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 Vaccine fact sheet for recipients and caregivers until after being administered the first dose of the vaccine. If she had been given the fact sheet for recipients and caregivers before being administered the first dose, she would not have gotten the vaccine because the sheet says not to get the shot if you are allergic to other medications or other reasons for allergies or on blood thinners. The patient questioned whether she should get the second dose as her physician said she should not get the second dose while on apixaban. The clinical outcome of "after her 1st dose, she had an allergy so bad" and "swelling and hives all over body" was unknown. Information on lot number/batch number has been requested.; Sender's Comments: Based on temporal relation and known safety profile of the vaccine, a causal relation between events allergy to vaccine, swelling, hives and BNT162B2 cannot be excluded. The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to regulatory authorities, Ethics Committees, and Investigators, as appropriate.

soreness started at the injection site; moved into this joints in the elbow and shoulder area; This is an initial spontaneous report from a contactable nurse (patient). An 82-years-old female patient received first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, Formulation: Solution for injection, lot number; NDC number; Expiry Date: Unknown) via an unspecified route of administration, administered in right arm on 03Feb2021 14:15 as single dose for COVID-19 immunization (at hospital). The patient medical history was none. The concomitant medications were not reported. History of all previous immunization reported none. Patient not provided the family medical history. Patient reported that both she and her husband received their first Pfizer COVID-19 vaccine shots 8 days ago (clarified as 03Feb2021). She said her arm was sore for 3 days, and then the arm soreness was gone. She said her husband's arm has been sore for 8 days, clarifying it was 8 days ago that her husband got the COVID-19 vaccine. She said her husband has tried Advil, Tylenol, hot packs, cold packs, and nothing seems to help his pain. Reported that she and her husband both received their first COVID-19 Vaccines on the same day and time, and the COVID-19 Vaccines were administered at the same facility. Treatment declined due to the reported stated that she did not need to take anything for her COVID-19 Vaccine injection site pain, saying the vaccine injection site pain went away on its own after 3 days. On 03Feb2021 the patient reported that she experienced soreness started at the injection site, moved into this joints in the elbow and shoulder area. The reaction of duration reaction/event: 03 days. Patient did not receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine The term highlighted by the reporter. The reporter classified the event as Non-serious and assessed the causality between the event and the vaccines as Related. The outcome of the events was recovered on 06Feb2021. Information about lot and batch number was requested.

Manager called the client later in the afternoon to report the vaccination error and there were no adverse reactions occurring at that time. Call was made the next day 4/3/21 to the client, reports a sore injection site. Call was made on 4/5/21 for follow up and soreness of the injections site resolved after 24 hours.

Close
COVID Vaccine I got my #2 Pfizer last Tuesday Apr 6....no problem at all with #1. The vaccination was in my LEFT arm, and the 1st day or so I didn't really have anything but tiredness. But the last few days have been very painful. I developed swelling on the RIGHT side of my face starting at the temple. That progressed down to the ear area the next few days and was quite painful. Since Saturday my tongue, lips, gums became swollen resulting in barely being able to swallow. Also rash developed and is getting worse. Additionally I ache all over and feel like a very bad case of the flu. I tried Tylenol Extra Strength in the beginning, but that seemed to only ease the pain for about an hour. Now I'm using Advil, which helps for several hours. Is there anything I can do to get relief. This is the 8th day....and it seems to be getting worse instead of better.

82 2021-04-30 vaccination site haemorrhage could hardly walk; arm was very sore; stomach was upset; Slight Headache; Diarrhea; Slight fever; Mu... Read more
Close
could hardly walk; arm was very sore; stomach was upset; Slight Headache; Diarrhea; Slight fever; Muscle ache; felt bad; Sore throat; bled after her injection; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer, the patient. An 82-year-old female patient received the first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 MRNA VACCINE; Lot: ER8727), via an unspecified route of administration in the left arm on 25Mar2021 between 15:30-16:00 (at the age of 82-years-old) as a single dose for COVID-19 immunization; apixaban (ELIQUIS) via an unspecified route of administration at 5 mg twice a day from an unspecified date in 2018 and ongoing as a blood thinner/for the heart. Medical history included diabetes (started a couple of years before 2018), arthritis, lupus since 2020 (started just 6 months ago), high cholesterol, heart disease, all ongoing; as well as aortic valve replacement and pacemaker in 2016; she had all 3 types of arthritis: osteo, rheumatoid, and the one with the rashes, she has had aches and pains for a long time; arthritis pain; heart surgery in 2016; COVID-19 in the last part of Jul2020 to the first 2-3 weeks in Aug2020 (and then tested negative on 19Aug2020) with the following symptoms: bad headache, muscle aches, diarrhea, loss of smell and taste, "just about everything" for almost 4 weeks, autoimmune disease, diuretic and muscle relaxant therapy. Ongoing concomitant medications included glimepiride for diabetes from 2014, potassium tablet as a diuretic from 2016, furosemide as a diuretic from 2016, metoprolol for the heart from 2016, atorvastatin for cholesterol, hydrocodone for pain, tizanidine as a muscle relaxant, cinnamomum verum (CINNAMON) capsule, ascorbic acid (VITAMIN C), fish oil, ubidecarenone (COQ-10), vitamin D3, paracetamol (TYLENOL ARTHRITIS PAIN) tablet for arthritis pain, and an unspecified multivitamin. There were no additional vaccines administered on the same date or 4 weeks prior to BNT162B2. On25Mar2021, the patient bled after her injection, the blood started running down her arm when they pulled the needle out. The patient experienced sore throat on 25Mar2021 at 22:00, which was not excruciating, and the patient did not take anything for it. After waking the next morning, the sore throat was gone. The patient took paracetamol daily in the morning, and she wasn't sure if that was why her sore throat went away or not. She stated that when she had COVID disease the paracetamol didn't help her sore throat or headache at that time. The patient then started to have muscle ache on 26Mar2021 and a slight fever, never over 98 degrees, and she felt bad. The patient's normal temperature was around 97 degrees. The patient experienced a slight headache on 27Mar2021, diarrhea for 1 day and stomach upset on 27Mar2021 and then diarrhea again on 31Mar2021 for 1 day. The patient didn't take anything for the diarrhea, it was not that severe. The muscle aches continued in the upper part of legs, thighs, upper arms to her elbows. The patient had never had a hurting like that in her muscles and on an unspecified date, the patient could hardly walk since it was hurting so bad. On an unspecified date, the patient's arm was very sore. The events did not require an emergency room or physician office visit. The patient did call her doctor because she was hurting so bad who informed her that he had heard of other people who had the disease were having a reaction to the first vaccine. The action taken in response to the events for apixaban was dose not changed. The clinical outcome of sore throat was resolved on 26Mar2021 (duration 1 day), muscle ache was resolved on 03Apr2021 (duration 8 days), slight headache was resolved on 04Apr2021 (duration 8 days), diarrhea occurring on 27Mar2021 was resolved on 28Mar2021 and diarrhea occurring on 31Mar2021 was resolved on 01Apr2021, slight fever was resolved on 26Mar2021 (duration 1 day), stomach was upset was resolved on an unspecified date, and of could hardly walk, arm was very sore, bled after her injection, felt bad was unknown. No follow-up attempts are possible. No further information is expected.

Caller stated the tiredness and chills lasted about an hour and she felt them when she was asleep and was tired all of a sudden. AEs not require a visit to ER or MD office. 82 2021-05-24 itchy skin, rash, vaccination site itchiness Itching/her shoulder started to itch like crazy/ Was itching so bad like a mosquito bite; Has a litt... Read more

Itching/her shoulder started to itch like crazy/ Was itching so bad like a mosquito bite; Has a little fever; Rash/rash is hot and has a temperature in it/Rash was a week later and was weird; Itching began 25Jan2021 at night at injection site; felt like an anxiety attack; Metal taste in mouth; Funny feeling in chest; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 82-years-old female patient received first dose of bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 MRNA VACCINE, Solution for injection), via an unspecified route of administration on 19Jan2021 at 17:30 (Batch/Lot number was not reported) as 1st dose, single for covid-19 immunization. The patient medical history and concomitant medications were not reported. The patient received flu shot and experienced shoulder pain, she received first week in Oct2020 at one of the grocery stores, she doesn't remember doing that the last year or before. On 19Jan2021, the patient had metal taste in her mouth and a funny feeling in her chest that felt like an anxiety attack. The next day was fine. The patient was not anxious prior to COVID-19 Vaccine, lasted for a couple seconds and then was gone. It was minor and was not short of breath or anything.On 25Jan2021, the patient had rash and week later 26Jan2021, her shoulder started to itch like crazy. didn't look at it until the next day. Looked in mirror and noticed a rash. Has a little fever, rash was still there and can see the rash around where the point of the needle went in. The patient did not know if that was important.On 27Jan2021 took a picture of the rash and was still there. Feels there was a temperature in the rash, but it was not hurting. Stated the rash site has a fever in it. Rash looked unhappy but took a long time to look unhappy. On day of reporting, patient noticed the rash was hot and has a temperature in it. It was not big and red but was still there. Surprising that rash appeared a week later. The patient did not go through primary care to receive COVID-19 Vaccine. Lab test included mammogram, CAT scan, and testing done at the hospital. A week later rash was weird and was itching so bad like a mosquito bite and was scratching and rubbing it, didn't look in the mirror. The patient doesn't know if rash was there when it started itching. Next day was when she noticed the rash. Stated rashes can itch if they are the allergic type of reaction. Thought it was very strange. On 19Jan2021, the outcome of event anxiety attack, metal taste in her mouth and a funny feeling in her chest was recovered and outcome of other events was unknown. Follow-up (16Apr2021): This follow-up is being submitted to notify that the lot/batch number is not available despite the follow-up attempts made. Follow-up attempts have been completed and no further information is expected.

This 82-yerar-old non-pregnant female received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, Solution for injection; lot number: EN6198; expiration date: unknown), via an unspecified route of administration in right arm on 24Feb2021 09:00am, as a unknown single dose for COVID-19 immunization. 82 2021-05-31 bruising, cellulitis Patient was admitted to referring hospital on 5/24/21 for tongue swelling . Per chart review, patie... Read more
Close
Patient was admitted to referring hospital on 5/24/21 for tongue swelling . Per chart review, patient's husband reported spontaneous bruising of right arm and swelling after received 2nd dose of COVID vaccine, which eventually came down. Repeat swelling occurred about 2 weeks prior to index admission, and was started on antibiotic for suspected cellulitis (cephalexin). Also reports of spontaneous brusing, as well as one episode of bleeding/oozing. At the ED, blood work revealed low hemoglobin (5.6) and PT 14.3, PTT >120. She was nasally intubated for airway protection. She was transferred to our institution on 5/25/21 for hematology work up and evaluation. Hematology evaluation is highly suspicious for acquired factor VIII inhibitor, and later confirmed with laboratory tests. She received recombinant factor VIII replacement (Obizur) as well as Emicizumab, as well as rituxamab for treatment acquired factor VIII inhibitor. Patient current still hospitalized.

This is a spontaneous report received from a contactable consumer or other non-healthcare professional. An 82-years-old female patient received second dose of BNT162B2 (COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE, Formulation: Solution for injection, batch/lot number: not reported) via an unspecified route of administration on 04May2021 as single for COVID-19 immunisation. The patient received first dose of bnt162b2 (BNT162B2) on 04Apr2021. The patient medical history and concomitant medications were not reported. A week after administration of second dose of vaccination, the patient had a measles-like condition on her skin, all over the body. It was described as not like a rash but more like measles, it started small and spreading like measles or a chickenpox where in it looked like blood patches and it has been getting worse and bigger and itching from inside out and has been eating her up. She has already consulted her general doctor and dermatologist and had 3 biopsy to see what else they can do. The dermatologist said that they had a report filed on this but no reference number and that the caller should also report. The caller also added that she felt bad because she was the one who had her mother get vaccinated, where in she could have just stayed in the house and not catch the disease. Caller is asking for any advise on how to improve her mother's condition since it has been getting worse by the day. Information on the lot/batch number has been requested.

bothers her is that her problem remembering words is getting worse./: Knees hurt was reported as worsened.; it started from the top of her neck and her balance was off, she felt "fuzzy-headed"; She has been experiencing periods of tiredness where she does not want to do anything; increased forgetfulness in addition to her intermittent light headedness; increased forgetfulness in addition to her intermittent light headedness; Was cold; diarrhea; her knees hurt her; chills; mild fever; her arm was hurting; Arm was just a teensy bit sore at the injection site; Felt a little like balance was off; So tired I don't want to do anything; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). An 82-year-old female patient received second dose of BNT162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, solution for injection, Lot Number: EN6199, Expiration date: Jun2021), via an unspecified route on 13Mar2021 (age at the time 82-year-old) as 2nd dose, single dose in the left arm for covid-19 immunization. The patient medical history included osteoarthritis, fibromyalgia (reported that she was diagnosed with fibromyalgia close to 20 years ago, between 15-20 years ago). The patient concomitant medications were not reported. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within four weeks prior to the vaccination. The patient previously received first dose of BNT162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, solution for injection, Lot Number: EL9269), via an unspecified route on 20Feb2021 at 10:00 (age at the time 82-year-old) as 1st dose, single dose in the left arm for covid-19 immunization. On 13Mar2021, the patient experienced armed was hurting, armed was just a teensy bit sore at the injection site, and the next day, on 14Mar2021 she had diarrhea and her knees hurt her and had chills and mild fever, was cold and felt a little liked balance was off. Patient reported that the next day, 15Mar2021, she was fine, on 16Mar2021 it started from the top of her neck and her balance was off, she felt fuzzy-headed, fuzzy headed feeling was now not so much, but she would have a day where she was so tired that she doesn't wanted to do anything. Patient experienced periods of tiredness where she did not want to do anything was reported as worsened and reporting increased forgetfulness in addition to her intermittent light headedness. Patient reported that she called the pharmacist who informed her that some reactions would go on for a few weeks. She reported that she was a senior, and most seniors had a problem where they couldn't remember a word then blinked and could've thought of it. She reported that the thing that bothers her was that her problem remembering words was getting worse and the problem remembering words had gotten worse from her baseline after she received the covid-19 vaccine, but it had stayed the same since originally worsening from baseline. Patient reported that the difficulty remembering words worsened around the same time that her fuzzy or lightheaded feeling began, and temperature was 99. 7. Patient explained that her armed did tended to hurt a little and that she received her shot in the affected armed and she was not sure if the diarrhea lasted the second day or not, but it resolved completely. she had a teeny problem with her knees and the covid-19 vaccine really nailed it. She reported that since she received the second dosed of the covid-19 vaccine, her knees had been terrible. She reported that what's really bothering her now was her knees. She reported that her knees were hurting so bad that she could've hardly walked. It was reported that patient visited to physician office. The outcome of the events diarrhea was resolved on Mar2021, armed was hurting was resolved on 14Mar2021, chills, mild fever, cold was resolved on 15Mar2021, felt a little liked balance was off was resolving, her knees hurt, so tired I did not want to be done anything was not recovered and other events was unknown. Information on lot/batch number was available. Additional information had been requested.

Left arm began to swell from 4 to 5 inches from the shoulder to 2 inches from the crease of her elbow, in the front, after second vaccine; her arm was swollen and red and the shape of an eggplant, it was that large; Itching on left arm, after the second vaccine; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). An 82-year-old female patient received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, solution for injection; Batch/Lot number: EWD175, Expiration Date: 31Aug2021), via an unspecified route of administration, administered in left arm on 07May2021 at 15:55 (at the age of 82 years old) as second dose, single for COVID-19 immunisation. The patient has no medical history (including any illness at time of vaccination) and no family medical history relevant to adverse effect. The patient previously received the first dose of BNT162B2 (lot number: EWD162, expiration date:01Jul2021), via an unspecified route of administration administered on left shoulder (as reported) on 16Apr2021 at 1:45pm (at the age of 82 years old) as single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. There were no concomitant medications. On 11May2021, the patient experienced that her left arm began to swell from 4 to 5 inches from the shoulder to 2 inches from the crease of her elbow, in the front, after second vaccine. It was further reported that redness and swelling of left arm are the size of an eggplant, 2.5 inches on the top part of the arm and 4.5 inches at the base of the swelling, a total of about 6 inches from top to bottom in length. There was also itching on left arm. Events did not result in Emergency Room nor Physician Office Visit. The patient stated that the for the redness, it has improved by a small amount, and was ongoing, she can still see the redness; for the swelling, it was still there, but was not as swollen as it was before and for the itching of left arm it was still ongoing a little and it was described as a minor itching. Patient was recovering from left arm swelling and redness of left arm but was not recovered from itching in arm. No follow-up attempts are needed. No further information is expected.
82 2021-06-23 rash with redness Nausea and vomiting; Nausea and vomiting; eyes started swelling and almost shut the left; Eyes and f... Read more
Close
Nausea and vomiting; Nausea and vomiting; eyes started swelling and almost shut the left; Eyes and face swollen up; there was a big old sore like staph like someone had poured acid on her/ sores on scalp; she doesn't have any taste; rash forehead/ the side of her forehead was red, like fire red, but it was "kicking"/ rash on nose/ rash all over the place; She was very warm that day/ she started feeling hot; she started burning on left side of her head; pain on top of the forehead/ pain at top of head shooting left side of face; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable nurse (patient; retired nurse). An 82-year-old female patient received the first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE, Solution for injection; Batch/Lot number was not reported), via an unspecified route of administration on the left arm on 29May2021 11:45 (at the age of 82-years-old) as dose 1, single for COVID-19 immunisation. The patient's medical history included sensitive skin. The patient's concomitant medications were not reported. History of all previous immunization with the Pfizer vaccine considered as suspect (or patient age at first and subsequent immunizations if dates of birth or immunizations are not available): None. No other vaccines administered on the same date of the Pfizer suspect. The patient had no other prior vaccinations within 4 weeks. Family medical history relevant to adverse events was reported as none. There were no relevant tests done. On 29May2021, the patient received the first dose of BNT162B2. She had the worse reaction and didn't know what to do as she hedn't read about it and now she was reading it and added that she was not taking another one. She should have gone to the emergency room, but she was afraid they would admit her. She had read this paper on what she should, and she had almost every time. She went to her physician on 25May2021, and that they were giving the vaccine at his office and that it would be on the Friday (28May2021). Her physician had said that she needed to take the virus shot, but Friday (28May2021), it would be like to 12 o'clock and she had been there on Tuesday for a physical. She said that they wanted her to make sure if she wasn't coming and reschedule. She said that she went to store on the following Saturday on 29May2021. After she got the shot, she sat there for 15 minutes and read a brochure and then stated that she had been there for 30 minutes. She was very warm that day and she went and did her little shopping and it was very hot. After she did all of the shopping that day (29May2021), she went somewhere else and when she did, she started feeling hot and it was hot outside and she thought she had better get out of the heat. She got home about 17:30. She got to feeling heat so bad and she sat on her porch which she always did before she goes in the house. She said later that day (29May2021), she started burning on left side of her head. Started burning like her head was on fire on left side of her forehead and it kept on. She had a sensitive skin, so she couldn't understand why it was burning so. She then stated that it was burning so bad she went to mirror to see what it was doing and added that the side of her forehead was red, like fire red, but it was "kicking". Her son told her to put some cold compresses on it. She stated that she had been putting warm and that it had helped. The patient had rash forehead and she had put warm compresses on it and laid down because it was feeling so bad and she went back and looked in mirror and it had turned into fire and rash all across left side of forehead. She said she thought she must be having reaction to this shot. The patient stated that she loved coffee but hadn't even drank her coffee because she doesn't have any taste on 29May2021. She then looked at the information that was provided and the next day (on 30May2021), there was a big old sore like staph like someone had poured acid on her and for 2 days, she didn't put anything on her head to touch it. The patient considered the events feeling hot as serious and persisting, rash on nose as serious, rash all over the place as disabling, but then commented it was medically significant, nausea and vomiting had improved but was serious, eyes and face swollen up and pain on top of the forehead as very serious (even with her sitting, she could feel the pain arising on the left side), and sores on scalp and head as serious as serious. The patient experienced heat at night and added that it felt like something was hitting her on the side of her head. She tried to get some ease and she got and tried to eat some soup. She then went to the bathroom and threw up (confirmed it was on 01Jun2021). The patient was still having pain on the left side, top of forehead and added that it was "shooting everything now and then". She then mentioned that it was coming back now. The patient then stated that it had been over a week and she was finally getting better. The patient stated that she wasn't going to the emergency room because they would want to admit her. She further stated that "you could to the emergency room with a thumbtack and be put on Intensive Care Unit" and reiterated that she wasn't going. The patient had rash in her hair and didn't want anything touching it as it was just painful and felt like a big old sore, like a scab. After two days on 31May2021, her eyes started swelling and almost shut the left. She applied Cortisone cream to rash on the 2nd day for one day only. Doesn't not have it available. No other treatment sought. The patient then stated that the rash, feeling hot, burning on left side of her head, rash on nose, pain at top of head shooting left side of face occurred later in the afternoon of 29May2021; while not provided for the other events. The events did not require a visit to the emergency room and/or physician office. The outcome of the events erythematous rash, nausea, and vomiting was recovering; for the events feeling hot, burning sensation, loss of taste, pain on top of the forehead/ pain at top of head shooting left side of face was not recovered; while for skin lesion, eyes swollen and swelling of face was unknown. The reporter considered the events to be related to the Pfizer COVID 19 vaccine. Information on Lot/Batch number was available. Additional information has been requested.; Sender's Comments: Based on chronological connection to the vaccine a causal relationship between reported events and BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE0 cannot be excluded. The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to Regulatory Authorities, Ethics Committees and Investigators, as appropriate.

An 83-year-old female patient received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 MRNA VACCINE), via an unspecified route of administration, on 15Jan2021 (at the age of 83-years-old) at a single dose for COVID-19 immunization. The patient's medical history and concomitant medications were not reported. The patient experienced shoulder/injection site pain and arm pain in Jan2021 and tired, dizzy, and unstable on 16Jan2021. The clinical course was reported as follows: The patient initially experienced shoulder/injection site pain and arm pain. On the next day after vaccination, she felt tired, dizzy and unstable. The day after was much better and on the fourth day after vaccination, she was back to normal. The clinical outcome of shoulder/injection site pain, arm pain, tired, dizzy, and unstable was recovered on 18Jan2021. No follow-up attempts are possible; information about lot/batch number cannot be obtained.

She thought she was going to pass out; felt like she was going to faint; chin felt funny; face was red; face was burning; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer(patient). An 83-year-old female patient received first dose of BNT162B2(Covid-19 vaccine, lot number EL8982), via an unspecified route of administration on 27Jan2021 10:00 at single dose, left arm for protection from virus, vitamin D(lot number 15070802 with expiration date Jun2023, Non-Pfizer product, manufacturer: 21st Century), orally from 2019 and ongoing at 2000 iU, daily, (25 mcg/1000 IU, takes 2 by mouth daily) for bones, vitamin b complex (B COMPLEX, lot number 14704704 with expiration date Apr2023, Non-Pfizer product, manufacturer: 21st Century), orally from 2019 and ongoing at unknown dose, daily, (2 by mouth daily) for energy, digoxin(Non- Pfizer product), orally from Jun2019 and ongoing at 0.125 mg, daily to slow the heartbeat, rosuvastatin(Non- Pfizer product), orally from 2019 and ongoing at 20 mg, daily to lower cholesterol. Medical history included high blood pressure, blood thinner, low thyroid. Concomitant medication included hydrochlorothiazide, triamterene (TRIAMTERENE HCTZ) from 2019 and ongoing for high blood pressure, rivaroxaban (XARELTO) from Nov2020 and ongoing as blood thinner, levothyroxine from an unknown date and from Nov2020 and ongoing for low thyroid(had been taking for 25 years or more). History of all previous immunization with the Pfizer vaccine considered as suspect reported as None. Prior Vaccinations (within 4 weeks) reported as None. The patient experienced felt like she was going to faint on 30Jan2021 with outcome of recovered on 30Jan2021, chin felt funny on 30Jan2021 with outcome of recovered 30Jan2021, face was red on 30Jan2021 with outcome of unknown, face was burning on 30Jan2021 with outcome of recovered on 30Jan2021. Caller was asking if she should get the second shot. She went to her doctor and was told it was ok if she got the second shot. The doctor said it was too far between the shot and the reactions for it to be the shot. She received the vaccine on 27Jan2021. On Saturday morning she took Vitamin D, B complex, Digoxin and Rosuvastatin. Twenty minutes later her chin felt funny. Her face was red and burning. She felt like she was going to faint. She got some ice and washed her face. She took 2 baby aspirin. She asked her doctor if she was allergic to the vaccine. Her doctor said the time between getting the vaccine and the events were too far between. She thought she was going to pass out. She felt better after washing her face with ice. She was her face for 30-45 minutes with ice water. She took apixaban (ELIQUIS) before and her chin felt funny. She added that her blood pressure went up and she had trembles. She felt dizzy. Clarified that she felt that way prior to taking the vaccine. At first she didn't think to take her blood pressure. When she took it the reading was 165/79. At 3:00 pm the reading was 162/79. At 6:00 pm the reading was down to 150/79. The trembles started two hours after she took her medications. When providing product details she stated she took two Vitamin D. The label indicated to take one. When asking for indication caller asked what does Vitamin D do? She was able to answer herself. Product is filled in a pharmacy bottle and does not include NDC, Lot or expiry. Prior to taking rivaroxaban (XARELTO), she was taking apixaban (ELIQUIS) 5 mg twice daily. Lot: ABL8694A, Expiry: Dec2022, It came from another country. She was sure she was allergic to it because she had a rash. That was when she was switched to rivaroxaban. She was taking levothyroxine 100 mcg until she turned 82. In Jan2021, the dose was changed to 112 mcg daily. Her last thyroid level was high on the test with a result of 7.46. The dose was changed to 112 mcg daily. Initially caller gave consent to contact her physician. She changed her mind stating she didn't want her doctor to think she was going over her head. She was worried and frightened at the time because something happened to her. She can't remember if her face was swollen. She drank some ice cold water and took two baby aspirins. She knew she needed to flush her system. She just wanted to make she was safe in getting the shot. Her doctor told her to take diphenhydramine hydrochloride (BENADRYL) if she ever felt that way. She felt fine after getting the shot and the few days after getting it. She wanted to get the shot. Events resulted in physician office visit. The action taken in response to the events for vitamin D, vitamin b complex, digoxin, rosuvastatin was dose not changed. The outcome of event "She thought she was going to pass out" was unknown.
